Review: Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

employee_title: CACI has a very strong values and works as meritocracy. As people prove the
location: CACI has a very strong values and works as meritocracy. As people prove the
Review:
CACI has a very strong values and works as meritocracy. As people prove their value to the programs they support their ability to advance endless.

Have been part of the company for over 10 years so clearly enjoy working here.

CACI has been a great company to work for. The medical benefits are VERY good and very affordable, they have parental leave, decent paid time off and federal holidays, and my management has been nothing but caring and supportive when I went through some difficult times. They made sure I was taken care of and could focus on my personal issue so I could resolve it and come back to work ready to go.

employee_title: SPAWAR Maritime Medical Automated Test Lead
Review: I worked for CACI for about 8 years till contracts ran out. The atmosphere was pleasant although demanding. There was NEVER a dull day, I was excited to work every day. If I had it to do again, I'd be there in abheart beat.
Management is very supportive. I worked for CACI for almost 20 years and during that time I worked on several large contracts. I always got the support that I needed.

review_title: Challenging, variety of projects available, mobility
Review:
CACI has proven to be a great company to work for. I am full time at a government client site and therefore the experience is determined by that factor. The work is rewarding, yet very challenging and requires daily learning, flexibility and collaboration with team members as well as the government.
I've been given the opportunity to learn software platforms, Visio, SharePoint and other tools and they have been very encouraging towards these endeavors, even offering online or vendor training to support.

review_title: Worked fully remote and had flexible hours
Review: I worked fully remote and had flexible hours while I was attending school full time. There was great communication and support from the management team.
Expect to give maximum effort and be professional at all times. No nonsense employer with careers in multiple facets of government work. Advancement opportunities from within.

My experience while working for CACI has been rewarding. I was given given an opportunity to work doing something that truly impacts lives. Hard work is definitely recognized and rewarded at CACI. The work environment fosters productivity and inclusion. One family, one mission!
Management makes many promises they cannot keep, managers can be very hostile, toxic, and petty. There are some good eggs but if you get stuck with a bad one things will never improve.

its a government contracting job with all the fun of one. team level leadership is good, but they are also in the same boat as you. higher ups dont really seem to care about conditions that much. its a huge company.

There was absolutely no oversight from corporate at the building i worked in, therefore the manager of the building had complete reign of his own little fifedom and there was nothing anyone could do. Employees would give the manager a horrible review every year and corporate was supposed to respond but when my managers boss is an old military buddy of his, well then everyone is S.O.L.pcompletely

Excellent company to work for. Great benefits. Continuous learning environment.

As a manager, I followed corporate guidelines and created metrics for the team to follow for continuity.

Enjoyed all parts of the job.

review_title: Always ethical and seeking to provide quality work to the customer.
Review: A typical day at work was to have a morning Scrum meeting, then design and program all day. I learned alot about working on a large scale system. Management was always ready and able to step in with solutions.

I was there when huge transitions were taking place. Lots of hiring due to a government contract. Two years later, lots of lay offs due to loss of government contracts. Training was not great back then but I am sure they have improved.

Avoid CACI at all costs. Pay and benefits are decent, but poor management and horrible HR makes it not worth it. The culture is really bad and the people are always worried about their job security that they are always looking for opportunities to stab you in the back and make you look bad. Not a good place to work at all.
This company is excellent. very flexible working hours. My job in particular as a analyst, I get to work around the ships. very hands on and not stuck at a desk.

Strong Company. Conducted background investigations for National Security with the Federal Government as a contractor. Conducted interviews and record searches for personnel requiring security clearances.

Working here was really good at first, despite lack of training in processes, just fumble along. Team is nice, but there are endless meetings and mounting expectations. It's a bit much, especially when something is promised, then reality doesn't match up.

Upper management made a bad choice that caused CACI to no longer receive their regular case load from the feds. With barely any cases to work, THOUSANDS of employees went without pay for months and upper management was still paid the entire time. CACI never admitted what really happened and strung employees along for months. CACI didn't want to pay people's unemployment, so they just cornered people into quitting, all the while acting like they were such nice people for not laying anyone off. Sure you didn't lay us off, but you weren't paying us either. Being on leave without pay for months with no answers and no end in sight is not a gift! If you can't afford to/don't want to pay people, at least fire them so they can collect unemployment and pay their bills! During that time, until people started threatening law suits, CACI actually expected new employees to pay back all training costs if they quit. So employees were on leave without pay for months, and if they quit, would have owed the company thousands of dollars. After the threat of law suits, upper management announced that employees would be allowed to quit without repercussions like it was their idea. Zero integrity. Total cowards. Don't care about the employees at all.
CACI says they care about national security, but all they really care about is making money. They create monthly stats that are impossible to meet and turn a blind eye. If you don't meet the stats you will be fired. So you have two choices: work more hours than you'll get paid for and do things correctly, or cut corners and pray you don't get caught.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

review_title: The good coworkers heliong each other
Review: I feel like in a group of people working and we’re all working on the same job if one is behind the other one who can go and catch them up so that we can all be on the same page I believe and team playing not letting One be looked down on the building them up so they can get up get up on the same speed as everyone else and if you have to provide extra training then get those people to nnfind me that they need

review_title: Production and fun place to work
Review:
A typical day at work is fast paced and rewarding, a lot gets accomplished, with great team effort to get a task done.

We care about each other and want all to succeed.
This company is all about bottom line. Worked there for 12 years. Promotions were non-existent. Raises stopped after 4 years. CACI is gender & age discriminate. Look elsewhere.
Good company to work for. Very flexible hours for remote employees. Decent benefits and good management culture helps employees advance and seek other opportunities within the company.

Great place to work. The company offers great benefits and a well work/life balance. They also offer lots of additional benefits not many other employers offer such as employee discounts and additional benefits for veterans.

review_title: Most enjoyable part of the job
Review: The most enjoyable part of my job was the people I worked with. We became family. I also had an outstanding manager that supported her employees and always had what was best for them at heart. This is hard to find in a workplace.

I worked for CACI supporting a government health agency. The hours were easily submitted and the checks always cleared. No additional requirements came from this company as the customer requirements were the main focus.

review_title: Good Company to work for if you do not know what you want to do.
Review: Great work-life balance as most work is done from home. Management communication could be better. Career advancement is not there. Job security could be a problem as this is a contracting company (matters on the contract). This is a great place to work if you do not know what type of career you want to have.
The company doesn’t care about you, you are just numbers to them and they will screw you just so they can save a few bucks. Management is terrible and communication needs a lot of work.

review_title: Very Productive and fun workplace with a lot of room to grow.
Review: CACI Technologies is a government contract company that I really enjoyed working for. They gave me room to learn and room to grow. They provided a great work and friendly family environment. Great teamwork and high moral work place.

This is by far the worst company I have ever worked for. The main VP provides a toxic environment. This company is unethical and does NOT believe in diversity. Many minority Sr leaders were fired or ran off. They lie about the job responsibilities and upper mobility and do not provide clear direction. No job security as you will be fired for even a simple mistake. No one is happy here.

review_title: CACI is a large company with many diffrent work environments, but I have been happy at everyone I have been in. CACI has a culture of flexibility.
Review: I love working for this company. It has a culture of flexibility. It is military friendly, and has job security. Feedback is encouraged from employees to make the environment better. Their are many opportunities to move up in the company.

The CACI Company/ co-workers are amazing and unified. Would work for them any day. Working with. This company and my team was a great experience and learning curve for me. They helped me realize what a true team, work life balance and progression really is.
CACI Inc works for varies Government Agencies. A lot of if is IT stuff, Training, Logistics. Its a good company to work for, they offer you a chance to work and move up.

The only good thing about this job was that you could pick your own hours and that you basically work from home. Management was horrible and did not do a good job at all. They would basically tell you that you did something wrong but would not assist in helping you fix the issue. I was basically pushed out of the job by not providing adequate work to meet all the metrics and then was involuntarily separated from the job. I think this was just because they hired a bunch of people to take care of the backlog and once it was gone, they no longer had any use for us. I do not recommend working for this company. At first the pay and benefits lure you in but it is not worth it at all.
I work in immersions classes and I am very happy with CACI. The pay is reasonable and the supervisors are super nice and caring. It is very easy to communicate with them.
Government contracting work. In less than a year I have changed projects twice, changed desks four times, given $11,000 in raises, and been laid off due to contract defunding. Good times...
The distributed team I worked on was very effective at accomplishing our project goals and supporting each other with moving tasks through our development lifecycle.

The lack of work and availability to make your hours will have you on Unemployment. The job, without warning, cut the workload and left Investigators to suffer and fend for themselves on paying their bills. Would not recommend.

CACI has a very good teamwork, focus, and productive environment. Their caring and servant leadership inspired everyone love to contribute more and more to reach the company goal. I learned tremendously from CACI company culture and work environment.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.
Best Federal contractor I’ve ever worked for. Great benefits. Awesome co workers. Great training. Competitive salaries. Lots of room for growth and mobility,

review_title: CACi was a good company to work for.
Review:
CACI was a great company to work for. The Program manager was outstanding and was very supportive of the engineers.
My peers were top notch professionals.
Was laid off the job due to the loss of a contract. I did recieve a letter stating nothing was wrong with my work that this was a no fault... laid off
CACI was a great company to work for for over 10 years. Having the support from a large company was also a great benefit. There were also great benefits for tuition reimbursement.
Working for CACI was probably the best contractors I worked for. I been wanting to go back but I’m still undecided. Very flexible and I got paid pretty decent for what I did.

This company and it's employees at the Chesapeake office allow for and support inappropriate employee relationships between its own colleagues while misusing government time, property and funding. Employees required to have high level security clearances abuse those rights and do not uphold the mission of the DoD IG.

CACI’s mantra is built on “ethics and integrity”...they don’t seem to realize this takes more than just words. Upper management spins info, withholding updates that seriously impact employees. Metrics are unreasonable and completely lose sight that the focus should be upon NATIONAL SECURITY and not on making leadership rich

review_title: Used to be great but deteriorated
Review: Change comes from the top and most of it was bad. Management infighting, playing favorites and complete lack of support. Obvious shady practices. It didn't used to be like this. I hope things change for the better but I wouldn't work for them again until it does.

review_title: CACI is a technology based company
Review: Company is big in the technical field always winning large government contracts. Not very good at taking care of it's employees but looking for maximum production.

I enjoy working there, it's a fun time great team. Very laid back type of atmosphere and everyone is always willing to help. I'm never afraid to ask for assistance on things and i get more experience.

review_title: I only worked for them for a short amount of time.
Review: They are a good company. Although my employment with them was very brief I have worked with them as partners on multiple occasions. They are very organized and do a great job with BD.
Love the company, so far i'm very happy with the organization as a whole. its allowed me to grow in my field, and give me the chance to work on many new projects and technologies.

Good work environment with good benefits and flexible work schedule. Room for advancement.
No overtime, on call and weekends off.
Paid vacation, medical, vision and dental.

review_title: Push to get work done. Little regard for people
Review: Constant work assignments. Directors were mouth pieces of accountants to increase bottom line. This conflicted to middle managers pushing to get better quality.

I'm very grateful to be part of this organization! My supervisor is extremely helpful and can always be reached, even though we work at different CACI locations.The company allows me to work remotely a couple times a week which is huge! Compensation is stellar, and benefits are excellent. Of course, expectations here are high and the job is very stressful, but I knew that beforehand and was ready for it. Connecting candidates with suitable roles at CACI is very rewarding, and I can say I truly do like what I do and hope the candidates are happy too. The rest of the people I work with on the contracts I was assigned to are knowledgeable and pleasant as well. Overall, can't say enough good things about this employer and hope to stay here for years to come.

The CACI SSC Procurement & Subcontracts department is a toxic disaster of ineffective management and zero leadership. Managers foster a culture of: backbiting, gossip, bullying, and disrespect, amongst other toxicities. Minorities have either been fired or have quit due to the toxic nature of the workplace in comparison.
Great flexibility as an investigator. Management was mostly great at the direct supervisory level, not impressed with the higher levels. Great benefits.

review_title: Overall, my work for CACI as a cryptologic analyst and curriculum develop was a very rewarding and challenging experience.
Review: I've worked for CACI Inc. for over 7 years. During that time I accumulated valuable experience of foreign language instruction and curriculum development. I also acquired an appreciation of working in a diverse workplace culture, where the management was always there to help and support the individual and team projects I was involved in. A typical day was filled with providing language instruction at all levels of proficiency (basic, intermediate, advanced) that included speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The rest of the day was spent preparing course materials and authentic instructional materials, and developing/implementing communicative, task-based, student-centered proficiency-oriented learning activities. The hardest part of the job was reaching out to those students who were struggling with understanding learning problems
CACI is a great organization to work for, they are open, friendly and productive. One of the best companies I have worked for, I would recommend this company to anyone.

review_title: Avoid working for the Background Investigation contract, very unstable work environment. Just furloughed 10% of staff.
Review: I spend the day reviewing multiple Background Investigation Cases for completeness, thoroughness and accuracy. I learned a lot after a very challenging and lengthy training and mentoring program. Constant metrics that must be met on a daily basis, with oversight that "dings you" for problems with the cases. This creates a stressful and negative workplace culture.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

review_title: Good place to work with good co-workers
Review: There is a clear direction in supporting the customer and we are valued within each of our areas of responsibilities. There are good benefits to have as well as great internal training opportunities.

Great benefits, flexibility as long as work was completed. Overall, not bad, not fantastic. Helpful support staff, i.e. facilities and HR. Helpful resources for completing admin tasks, but there were a million admin tasks to do on a regular basis.

A very energetic organization that provides room to grow and allows members to be fully engaged
Management - Great
Co-workers - Very helpful and willing to share knowledge

Depending on where you are in the company there may be an issue with career/life balance. Company has a decent benefits package, has a virtual college that gives access to higher training, and there are ways to apply for other positions on other contract vehicles.

Very limited training. Overall lack of corporate standards. The program has existed for over 3 years and the corporation did not ensure that basic standards were applied at program start. Now employees are scrambling to apply standards while trying to deliver to the customer.
Work with a team to accomplish tasks and assist investigators. Do your part to ensure the well-functioning of the workplace. Rewarding and fun experience.
The workplace culture is easy going. The most enjoyable part of the job is that it balances with family life. The management is very supportive and always available.
My current project is meaningful to the customer. They seem to have meetings to schedule meetings and micromanage the team. Not the greatest for our team but bearable most of the time.

Company management cares only about their bonuses and short term objectives that support their personal success. There is no effective program for job advancement, retention, or satisfaction. Employees are simply cogs in the big machine.

review_title: CACI International Inc Best Company to work for if you want to give back to the military
Review: CACI looks out for their employees and this company is the best in the contracting business. Its not easy landing a job with this organization. But I guaranteed you will be happy to work for a very important and successful company that contentiously assist are Military and civilian government workers.

review_title: An excellent place to witness people being targeted by management
Review: Basically, management is a good ol boy system where your input and contributions only reflect on your team lead. Experience and training matter only to the government customer and company management will actively work to have you removed if you make a complaint or have issues. I have seen this happen personally 8 times in a period of 4 years. Most recently a manager was "let go" for an inappropriate relationship with a subordinate. Everyone on the contract was threatened not to talk about it as this person made a transition to a government role in charge of those that made complaints against him.
If you love to be challenge daily and learn something new every since day, CACI is place for you. Benefits is not amazing but good enough. CACI is fair and good company
Productive but busy work environment with 12 hour shifts which is not too bad considering the four days off every other week. Mgmt are nice and willing to work with you.
Its a great company to work for. Work and life balance, benefits are good. I learned many new technologies. It has a very casual environment and there is lot scope for career advancement.

review_title: CACI is much like many other large business
Review: CACI is much like many other large business. Sometimes you will get a good supervisor and sometimes not. I had both while working for CACI. Thankfully most of them where good

employee_title: Program Manager/Service Desk Lead - EOP - Project Management
Review: CACI has been the best company I have ever had the opportunity to work for. The opportunities to learn, advance and grow in my career have been endless and I would always highly recommend this company.

review_title: Government contracting jobs come with the risk of insecurity through reduction in case inventories.
Review: Somewhat flexible work schedules, fair wages, professional managers. Benefits are good. Some training given if new skill sets are required to carry out new projects.

This company has a very hostile corporate work environment and they treat their non-corporate divisions like they are unserviant subordinates. They company uses fear to dominate its employees and fires without provocation or cause, to mask the fact that they have no control over the government projects they have. Image and profit rule supreme and backstabbing is the standard modus operandi .

employee_title: Serve as Functional Consultant P3 at CACI inc
Review: You couldn't ask for better people to work for and around. They are always concerned with your work and home well being! The benefits are great and they are always looking for ways to improve them!

review_title: productive and well organized work place
Review: work in a productive environment with highly experienced managers and supervisors, with very helpful teamwork, you can improve your acknowledgement and experience, well organized management.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

They break federal labor law and then discard their employees like they are trash when their PTO is burnt away. They also make promises to lure you in and immediately break them. Avoid CACI at all cost!

review_title: The management team needs to be terminated
Review:
They say they promote within and you are a valued employee.
False - Management has their own set of rules and if their friend wants your role they take it.
CACI has highly competitive pay, and so-so benefits, and PTO accrues very slowly. Management does not care about their employees and will not support you.

review_title: They are a conduit to government SAP jobs
Review: I'm not impressed with CACI leadership. I think they got a big contract or two but not sure. I wish there was more inclusion from management to the lower levels.
I was satisfied with this employer until they furloughed employees without notice. I learned about at company and will miss my job. Could have handled the furlough better.
Love working here. Flexible schedule. Work from home. This is one of the best jobs I have ever had in over thirty years in my chosen career. I would recommend working here to anyone interested.
There is nothing to say. I am not going to put job business out here. I don't believe in talking about a company when they are not aware of it happening.

The work environment was very flexible however the work became less stable and there were several changes in executive leadership in a short time. This caused a lot of changes in a short time and a lot of staff were laid off.
Left a different contract to work for CACI. Laid off after 8 weeks. Loss of funding. I will never trust this company because of it. It was a very disappointing experience.

review_title: Background Investigator - Overwhelming Work, Out of Place Culture
Review: Non-inclusive culture. Quick to judge you and disprove you based on ethnic background. Bad experience with management. Felt feeling of non-inclusion or lack of patience for having such diversity in background. Didn't last 2 months - was terminated. They don't embrace mistakes or failures for learning the role towards improvement and proficiency. Wish I didn't work there.

Excellent management. Very good environment. Every one is there to help you. Excellent benifets and everyone's culture is respected.Work shops and trainings are offered for advancement.Paidtime for trainings and for education tution fee is paid. Love to work here.

review_title: Great place to work, very supportive.
Review: CACI is very supportive and welcoming company. There is plenty of opportunity for growth and mobility. Big environment and they are really focused on training personnel.

review_title: Management is awful and corporate does nothing
Review:
Management criticizes employees and shares their personal/confidential information
I’ve never felt so insecure working for a company in my life! There is way too much child like criticism HR in Lexington Park has always been a joke I learned of everyone’s family issues and mistakes these people are mean and are far worse than school bullies

Management focus is on the customer, not the employee. Pay and benefits are competitive with other companies. The company has some talented employees, however, in my experience they are wiling to hire lower skilled employees in order to cut cost.

review_title: Flexible hours and relaxed work environment
Review: My typical day consists of working 8 hours in a relaxed and flexible work environment. Everyone gets along and we are able to grow professionally and develop leadership skills if desired.
Great People to work with. Job has purpose and clients are some of the most important agencies in the government. Competitive Pay. Flexible schedule and managers.
CACI was great at first but as the contract went on the company seem not to care about the employees but more about the managers and other high up in the company.

review_title: Can be good but no stable career with this company
Review: They are government contractors and most of the industries they are in are very competitive and they over hire, you can go from 40 hours a week with overtime to ZERO in an instant, good gap filler but don’t go looking to retire fat and happy with them 25 years from now

I work alone from home and in the field. We meet monthly as a team had weekly team conference calls. The team members are helpful and supportive of one another in providing information about client sites or answering questions about processes.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

they feed you nothing but fakenews. From direct supervisor to higher managements, they will lie straight to your face about your job security and benefits. Next thing you know they are slashing your salary by 15-20k 6 months into their newly multi billion dollar contract. When its time for contract renewal, they will absolutely do their best to bolster their employees resumes and give them assurances to stay on the contract but after the contract is won, they will basically blame it on the new contract
My only issue with CACI was that they could not provide job security. I liked my job and was one of the top performers with this company. I had a total of 12 years work history with the company.

employee_title: Senior Weapons Technical Intelligence / Device Attribution
Review:
CACI is a good place to work, however compensation is not comparable to similar jobs within the industry. The atmosphere is preferable, as it is a great community of people.

The issue with CACI is the lack of communication between corporate and contracts and their inability to effectively fix or address issues in a timely manner.

employee_title: Senior paralegal, various litigation support positions
Review: I worked at CACI for 7 years and was able to move up, earn more money, and move onto different projects. I saved some money and. Gained some computer skills. I had some managers there who were supportive and creative: some not, and one supervisor who violated policy; I think she was racially biased. (I am white).

I came into the position as a developer with more knowledge of the stack than the tenured personnel, as far as the platform and technolgoies being used. However cronyism and clickish exclusionary behavior by my lead and other personnel on the team, kept me from integrating effective standards based thought processes. My attempts to introduce standards based design into what was a very badly designed system were generally marginalized until a Caucasian millennial on the team validated that it was a good idea while reintroducing it as their own, some time after they laughed at my proposed updates at previous meetings. I consistently found myself being passive-aggressively ridiculed under the guess of a joke, or my ideas undermined by my team lead, who was a subcontractor as well as by other subcontractors within the group that knew less than I did about the technologies with which we worked. Much of my time was spent waiting to get tasking because the lead, who was not qualified for her position and basically would complain about there being "too many objects" when our environment was a Java based SOA development team. Due to her ignorance of true enterprise or senior level Java development experience, she let a socially accepted more junior engineer do whatever he wanted because he was accepted as a local SME on everything computer science. (Also there was a demographic difference such that I seriously considered it an EO complaint situation.) In all the experience drained me and while I thought I was being jovial and happy to come in to work earlier in the year, personnel

review_title: Fun workplace, family friendly, flexible work schedule
Review: Great place to work. Work the schedule you need to get your job done. Management is good, and have no issues with jumping in where necessary. I've worked two different programs while at CACI and I learned a lot on both. The enjoyable part of the job was the learning, and the teams on which I've worked. The hard part? Leaving them.
Great company to work for with outstanding benefits and perks. The only problem I forsee is the 3 Year vesting period for 401K. I hope this changes in the near future for new employees

review_title: Great Place for a Transitioning Veteran
Review: I worked here fresh out of active duty in the Navy. They treated me fabulously. I felt like a real human being instead of just a cog in a machine. My on-boarding was incredibly slipshod, but I found my place through my own initiative.

This company puts more time and effort into ensuring that the workers and customers are as happy and fulfilled as they can be. Mix that with a competitive nature and an ability to adapt, it is no wonder why they've become the company that they are today.

employee_title: Provide technical support for software issues
Review: Very productive place to work with coworkers that are willing to assist when needed. A place that will help you grow weather educational wise or career.

A typical day started with the same meeting to plan the next meetings to go over the same topics. Meantime missing critical time with customers. Management asks for input then don't want to hear it. The hardest part of the job is getting everyone on the same page. Lacks work life balance.
Most enjoyable time is when employees call or show up and remind you why your there.

The manager of IT Remote Support personnel at the Chantilly, VA. location really platys favorites. She has 2-3 guys she is really "involved" with and doesn't make new comers feel welcomed. She has been there for some time so upper management trust her judgement despite this shortcoming.

review_title: Could have been a great company - Steer clear if you are an Investigator!
Review: I was recruited by CACI while employed as a Background Investigator for another company. CACI's benefits were great and they offered a higher salary than I was making, so I jumped on the opportunity. As a credentialed hire, there was little to no training. CACI internal systems (timekeeping, in particular) are incredibly complicated compared to any other company I worked for. CACI promised a great work-life balance, which was nice until October 2019 when CACI stopped receiving cases and thousands of investigators, including myself, no longer received paychecks with NO notice. The higher-ups preached that the work would come back, and to just "hang in there". Well, it didn't, nor does it seem like it is ever coming back. I would strongly recommend looking elsewhere if you are an investigator.

employee_title: Training Analyst/Senior Chinese Language Instructor), Lead
review_title: It was a decent company to work for until recently
Review: It used to be a good company to work for, but recently, due to poor contract negotiation with the government, the program I was working under way underbid, the budget shortfall is so severe, they have to layoff high paying, senior employees.

review_title: One of the better employers I've had
Review: CACI exists to service government contracts, primarily. As such, they are subject to the whims of the agencies offering those contracts, and tend to be cost-squeezed which makes it very difficult to keep senior, experienced people for very long.

review_title: Proactive working environment and one of growth and innovation.
Review: An outstanding company, always willing to work with the employee and also increase the value of the company by providing training and support when needed. An amazing management staff that is always willing to listen and roll up its sleeves if the need is required. Provided a motivating work environment that yielded the opportunity for the employee to enjoy what they were doing and demonstrate the value to the company and customers alike.

I really enjoy working for CACI. My typical day as an FMV analyst can be extremely hectic, but its worth it. CACI is the prime on the contract, but always treats their sub-contractors as if they were employees, which is how it should be. They pay decent and I don't know of any other company that offers four weeks of paid maternity AND paternity leave. The management is a slight hassle to deal with, but I haven't had any real issues with anybody so far. Great company.

This job was ok. I have had worse but I have have better. This job was propbably not similar as most jobs at CACI because I was alone working at an outstation where most others generally work with a team.

review_title: Enjoy working with great peers and meeting so many interesting people !
Review: I enjoy working with great peers, so many of whom are so willing to mentor a new investigator and provide great advice. I also enjoy meeting so many interesting people !
The company is similar to the rest of the large-scaled contracting firms. Work/life balance greatly depends on the customer needs. Company benefits are on par with the rest of the large firms.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.
Caci is an amazing company to work for, not only are the benefit options worth using the personnel there are extremely professional and supportive of each other.
CACI is a great company. They are incorporating new incentives to make the work place even better. The workplace culture was very good. The employees enjoyed each other and worked well together.

No further comments. No further comments

Caci does not care about its employees. I was laid off of no fault of my own. Caci promised to fine me a new position but never even tried.

The investigator job is flexible and you get to work remote. The company is a large one that focuses on government contracting. Overall, the company is fair, however the only thing that is not controllable is the contracts they obtain, which can be unstable at times within the investigations division,

Government contract worker. CACI was not the Prime on the contract. Subject to Government rules and regulations and the Prime contract holder policies. Though I was there 3 years, I believe that the work environment would have been much better under CACI management.
Work independently but in a group environment. On your own to figure things out and large work load. Good for experience but also be prepared to do non-essential and other repetitive tasks.

I was really excited to work at CACI and still do like working here. My biggest problem is that the work is not consistent and the demand of work does not equal the pay. The benefits are great and my first line Supervisor is fantastic but the upper management is so far removed from what everyone in the field is doing.
Management is sorely lacking, provided little resources, terrible work environment, Expectations set way to high. They try to do to much with to little people,

review_title: Company "ran out of work" less than 1 year after being hired.
Review: Need to have excellent time management and organizational skills. You must adhere to specific rules and regulations that concern other people's privacy. You could be charged with a felony for violating some of these.

I enjoyed working from home. When the workload got low on the contract employees didn't get paid. Have a back up plan while working as a contractor. They only care about the contract not the employees.
Employer understands we all face challenges in life/family, and helps you find a good balance between your work and family life. I would recommend working for this employer.

review_title: Company is good if your in IT or Cyber Security
Review: Nothing about the job is very difficult. The thing that is difficult is the lack of accountability and lack of mobility. Management is in effective and complacent.

Background Investigations field is very challenging career field. It take a long time to learn the ins and outs of the job. Once you begin to master the skills the position is rewarding and a good job field.
Poor management of work assignments to field investigators. Field investigators are not given a chance to improve their individual weekly stats in order to have a chance to be assigned more work.

High requirements for amount of work completed in a short period of time. Not allowed to work overtime to get work completed. Drive time counts toward hours of your week so you have to cram all of your reporting time in or work off the clock to get everything completed in the time they want it done. Not worth the stress.
CACI has been a great experience for me as a junior within the IT field, there is a ton of room for growth and many different opportunities to explore.
Played semantically games instead of real integrity in each area! Kissed the feet of OPM even when they knew their employees were correct and OPM was dead wrong!

review_title: I didn’t work in the main office, I was sub-contracted to work on a military installment.
Review: CACI was great at returning phone calls and helping with any issues I’ve had. I was sub-contracted through them to work on a military installment. It really seems as is the office is really on top of things and manages their employees very well.

review_title: CACI overall good company; however, location I supported in Hampton Roads, Virginia, culture was toxic, leadership unfairly applied company principles
Review: Overall, good company; however, some specific issues included high turnover, lack of diversity in leadership, leadership inconsistently promoted/degraded staff; no consideration for career experience in promotion; promotion was based on favoritism; leadership lacked cohesiveness & sound plan/ wayahead for future

review_title: Great job until becomes incredibly unstable
Review: Overall I loved this job; make your own hours, flexible schedule, work from home, and fun job. It was great until they completely took away all of our hours suddenly and have been asking us to stay with no pay. There is no plan to get the people on leave with no pay stability and no plans on how to maintain stability in the future.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

Your career depends on contact renewal.
In short looking for work now due to loosing top spot on our contract. Management was great and training is top notch. KCMO Team

location: A Project Operations, Deployment Analyst (Current Employee)
Review: The company is large so people are dispensable. There isn't a good opportunity to broaden horizons. Mainly do your job and go home. There could be better retention strategies than throwing money at people.

review_title: Great company to stay with and grow
Review: I enjoyed the autonomy of working a remote location. Good benefits. If you want to advance or change jobs, you must be vocal and develop a strong relationship with HR, not just your location supervisor. HR team in Hanover is awesome and very patient!

review_title: Some good people but not so much management
Review: Had some problems with the way things were ran and the way I was treated while working here. Overall might not be a bad place to work for some people.

The leadership on the program was easy to deal with and made the employees feel welcome. My direct manager was continuously providing guidance on some of the amazing benefits of the company. Would definitely work for the company again.
I have just started working at CACI, but the company seems to be a great place to work, with mentors at all levels. No will fail working for CACI. Anytime I need assistance someone always helps.
poor place to work. Only concerned with making numbers. Does not care for life circumstances to include family issues. Would not recommend this position

CACI ran out of work on the contract leaving thousands of people without paychecks with no notice. When there is work, the job is good. Work from home except when doing interviews and pulling records.

review_title: CACI is a great place to work
Review: CACI has been my career for 21 years and has given me all available opportunities to grow from within. I was able to start at the bottom and work my way up to management.

CACI has a professional work environment. The benefits and pay are really good too. However, you can be laid off, like any other company if the work is not there, since a lot of it is winning contracts.
This employer trained me with the basic skills to become a competent and efficient background investigator. This position prepared me for more challenging opportunities.
Abusive to investigators. Negative to work there as a couple times a week investigators are informed we have written reports wrong. Management does not listen.
This career provided the opportunity to build my foundation in field investigations. I learned and excelled greatly working with CACI. A very professional environment with opportunities for growth.

review_title: Work and happiness varies by Business Group
Review: I have thoroughly enjoyed my time with CACI, but the company rewards those willing to go the extra step. Different business groups have access to different benefits and the management of those groups vary. The overall company has made strides to balance this, but it is a difficult issue to resolve.

review_title: it's a job, and cover your expense
Review: the company is alright, but the benefit package is not well compare with small companies, they are keep cutting down the budgets, signed many contacts with govt, however, where's my bonus?

CACI pays to much attention to their employees, the micro managing needs to slow down. Employees should be trusted to do their job and it will show through the monthly report cards. I never had a problem with the micromanaging, but I know a lot of people that do not like having to tell their manager constantly when they have to leave work. This is a remote job and employees should be trusted to do their work.

Since the vendor position dropped to third under another vendor the work ceased. You cannot expect people to go on leave without pay (LWOP) for a month and a half and then after that time not even know when or if the work will come back. I had to resign.

CACI started off as a great company. Training seemed long but I felt it could have been longer and more support from upper management for new employees. As time passed, they were fair with their work and accessibility to problem solving was decent. I am currently looking for a new job because the company has a very low influx of cases that has affected all investigators and we are now forced to be in a part time position. This literally happened overnight without a warning. The company is now recommending we apply for partial unemployment until we receive more cases.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

The type of work that I did was all about the mission. Since the work was all about the mission it was very rewarding. It give me the chance to give back to the military from which that I was all about.

review_title: You have to give them your life
Review: My manager started showing up at my house unannounced. I was never given any kind of write up or anything for it to be necessary but I could deal with that for a while. However, once she started inviting other coworkers I had never met and had no idea who they were, I quit on the spot. You have the legal right of exclusion and to be the one who decides who enters it. CACI infringed on that right.

I started my employment with CACI on May 24, 2019. I should have known that it was going to be a terrible experience from the beginning. Someone dropped the ball and my start date ended up being two weeks later than expected. I was not given information from my recruiter about the process of transferring my credentials. My thought on this was, "everyone makes mistakes and it'll be ok." I should have known better. The communication problems only worsened from there. I was given a name and told that this would the person that would help me navigate through the on boarding process. I was more or less on my own. I could email and ask questions and wait hours or days for a response. I had no idea what needed to be completed or how. I'm still finding out things that I am supposed to be doing on a daily, weekly or monthly basis and had never been made aware of. I did my timecard training and asked for more information on time strings...what times strings to use and for what business. That took months to get answers. I had no idea for the first month that there was an admin time string, a local long distance time string or time strings for training, team meetings and IT issues. God knows I needed that IT issues time string.

For the first two months that I turned in expense reports, I submitted my mileage for each day that I traveled for work. I got paid and everything was great. The third time I turned in an expense report, it sat and sat. I contacted the reviewer and he advised that I need to submit the case name and case numbers for each day of travel. I didn't
CACI is a great company to work for with room for growth in the right career field. The company offers benefits to include medical and dental, 401K and tuition assistance.

As a background investigator, I love my job. I work from home, make my own schedule, and enjoy the work I do. My manager tries to micromanage, but also helps me understand the requirements for promotion which is a huge jump is salary. My benefits are excellent. We are susceptible to furlough and unexpected changes in work assignments due to government releases in the amount of work, but when the workload is full, it is rewarding, flexible, and autonomous.
Things were awesome until there was no more work on the contract. Now investigators are without work and without pay. It seems CACI over hired and now we are all paying for it. No job security.

review_title: Absolutely love the work...when there is work
Review: I cannot believe how much I love being a background investigator, however, it was short lived, as there is no work flowing in. And if there is no work flowing in, that means, you don't get paid.

review_title: Solid company with a good reputation within the security industry
Review: CACI is a great place to work. Compensation is very competitive and they provide ample training opportunities. The company is supportive and promotes career growth.

review_title: Easy Work however I was given a different position than the one I accepted
Review: The work load was not very difficult however I applied for another job and was given a complete different position on my start date. My position was switched with another contractor so I did not actually work in the role I was looking forward to working in.

I like working for CACI International, Inc. because it is demanding work professionally and CACI allows us the flexibility in our schedules to fulfill our responsibilities to our families and to the company. They are supportive of our needs.
I started at CACI back in 2010 and there I learned a lot and I was able to get a promotion allowing me to advance in my career. Met some great people, for whom im still in contact with to this day.

review_title: Remote work from home flexible, work life balance
Review: As a contractor, set your own schedule week to week, day to day. Learned how to interview, build relationships, write reports, time management. Very laid back non-micromanagerial style of management. The culture is inclusive and team supportive. The hardest part of the job is keeping up with case loads at times, setting appointments and continuously meeting goal metrics. The most enjoyable part of the job is the flexibility, work life balance, and home office.

employee_title: Senior Workforce Analyst & Sr. EEO Manager
Review: CACI was a good place to work. The day to day operations with on person on clients staff was stressful. Expectations were very high and would step in to complete task on own if it was not performed to personal standards

My experience with CACI has been a net positive. I needed a full-time job while I was going to school, and CACI provided a flexible schedule that enabled me to do just that. I enjoyed being relatively autonomous - no micromanagement, no pushy managers, etc. I got to choose my schedule and projects. HR was friendly and personable. The trade-off is that I was slightly underpaid for my skillset, and there were no scheduled raises.
I really liked this job. great team to work with and managment was great too. to bad they closed shop in denver i would have work there till retirement. i liked that job.

review_title: Employees have to complete a certain amount of Remedy Tickets each day to be productive on job.
Review: I have worked with CACI for 3 years, at this time, job has been stable, but I am attempting to advance my career. Employees are very knowledgeable how to complete there jobs.
Stable company, good benefits, good work environment, nice management, flexible schedule, good training, good hours, nice HR, nice company, over all good environment.
I enjoy working for CACI International. They treat their employees well and there is room for growth if that is something you desire in your career. Overall a good company

At this company it gave me the opportunity to hold myself accountable for my work being completed on-time and at its highest quality. Through this company I have been able to put my diligence and organizational skills to the test. I have definitely learned a lot from this job so far and I intend to take these skills with me to the next job opportunity.
Good opportunity to learn and challenge ones self to adapt to customer needs and requirements. If training is needed it is provided and cross training is important so the growth opportunity is good.

review_title: Working here did not further my career
Review: CACI has goals to be a great place to work with opportunity to grow professionally available to all. Perhaps that is true for some of their divisions but it wasn't true when it came to their division of Background Investigations. There is little to no room to grow professionally and be promoted. Sure you can increase the level or step of your current position, but to go outside of that role is slim unless you agree to relocate out of state. Internal politics is a big factor in whether or not you will be promoted as well. If you voice concerns the management would rather you kept quiet, you will find yourself stonewalled from professional advancement.

review_title: Great working environment. Casual, yet very professional.
Review:
My review of the company is favorable to all who work there and everyone in management and throughout. The everyday structure was sometimes predictable like any office environment and other days were completely unpredictable and a bit overwhelming.
We maintained a very positive and professional work environment and a really enjoyable experience.
The hardest part of the job is usually the learning, but learning is only arduous if you detest the people around you, and that was not the case at all. I enjoyed almost everyone I worked with and would do it all over again. I am only saddened by the fact that I had to leave due to lifes journey.
Great learning and working environment.
Work from home with flexible work hours. Get to meet very interesting people and be able to enter secure government facilities. Bi-weekly teem meeting via Skype.

review_title: Good place to work - needs management
Review:
Caci is an overall good place to work; however they need to look at their management there. No back bone to uphold any issues going on. It is over looked or brushed under the rug.
Slow work.

Typically on site military work environment. CACI team and other contractors are integrated within the Government and Military personnel. So the CACI employees are separated and cannot get a fill for the total CACI experience..

Wouldn't recommend working for this agency. During training the Management in Virginia was taking down about USIS to us former USIS investigators it showed their weak character and inability to be professional.

review_title: Section Lead had zero people skills and has no business in Mgmt
Review:
I was disappointed that CACI did not live up to their promises. I was told many times that my productivity stats would NOT be held against me for the first 6 months of the job but that was not true. We were constantly being pressured to do more work w/o doing overtime otherwise we would be charged with timekeeping fraud. I have never received so many threats both in the hiring process and after becoming credentialed. I have come to the conclusion that CACI runs this program by intimidation and OPM should be ashamed of themselves for allowing this. The job is highly bureaucratic and disorganized. You must rely on IT systems that are constantly failing. You have at least 3 levels of review on your reports no matter how good a writer you are and there are people constantly sending your work back to you. One step forward, four steps back.
You will receive a company iPhone so they can monitor your location. You will receive a company laptop but you are not allowed to use ANY Windows or Microsoft software, even if you have better ideas than the mandated software packages, by keeping Microsoft out of the mix you cannot organize your workload properly. Everything about the laptop is strictly controlled. You must use two different VPNs which means half of your programs cannot be on at the same time as others. I have never wasted so much time logging in and out of programs in my life!! This job is the definition of Fraud, Waste, and Abuse... Shame on Congress for allowing this to happen.

Involved with several projects on the base. Great working environment and strong leadership with the teams. If you wish to advance, you will have to work that on your own. Not a lot of clear delineation for career growth.

I have a TS/SCI clearance but they said I was suspended, after 3 weeks of training, for some reason! I’m still waiting. I’m going to EEOC because it’s been 6 months! CACI is good but not background investigator!

review_title: Working in CACI is a very good and challenging experience
Review: Very good place to work there. Work life balance is very very good in CACI. All staffs members are very respectful and caring people over in CACI. I have very good experience there.
I've had a great experience with CACI thus far. Don't have anything negative to say. The company has a very unique and precise way of doing things and it works.
Totally unprofessional people at a certain location. Extremely hostile work environment base on race, disability and supervisory people making inappropriate comments about wives/husbands

review_title: fluid work environment with shared ideas among associattes
Review: CACI is a work environment were ideas are shared among the different departments and encouraged. Managers are in tune per say with those personnel under their charge in my experience.

CACI is a great company to work for. They allow for internal growth as an employee with many opportunities available to you through e-learning and other training. The management team is great and very concerned with your personal growth. The only nerve racking part of the job is when contracts may or may not be extended/awarded, but CACI will typically reassign you to a different project (if you qualify).

By far the most rewarding and satisfying position I've held. This was a contacted government job servicing our military and their families. There were many stressful days but all worth it when families were at peace with the assistance provided.

CACI is a wonderful organization to work for that encourages constant professional development by providing various free avenues continued professional education. Managers within CACI work hard to foster a healthy work environment.

review_title: Learn new things and skills to help with other jobs
Review: This job has changed my mentality of work as a whole. It has encouraged me to go above my standards and try new things and also learn new task/skills.

review_title: I work at a government site and they treat us like their own
Review: CACI has been pretty good to me. I'm just having a difficult time moving into a new position within the company after getting my masters degree. They help pay for school and furthering your education.
Great Mentors, Flexible Schedule. Everything is given in extensive detail. You will meet some amazing individuals; from co-workers to the Subjects. Everyday is truly an adventure.
One of the best companies i worked for, great boss, great salary, great working environment and the best support from every direction. Great benefits as well
